solution_line_template: If Marvin solved {marvin_solved_yesterday} math problems yesterday, he has solved {marvin_solved_yesterday}*{marvin_today_multiplier} = <<{marvin_solved_yesterday}*{marvin_today_multiplier}={marvin_solved_today}>>{marvin_solved_today} math problems today.

The total number of math problems that Marvin has practiced is {marvin_solved_today}+{marvin_solved_yesterday} = <<{marvin_solved_today}+{marvin_solved_yesterday}={marvin_total_problems}>>{marvin_total_problems}

Arvin has practiced twice as many as Marvin, so has practiced {marvin_total_problems} * {arvin_multiplier} = <<{marvin_total_problems}*{arvin_multiplier}={arvin_total_problems}>>{arvin_total_problems} problems.

Together, Marvin and Arvin have solved {arvin_total_problems}+{marvin_total_problems} = <<{arvin_total_problems}+{marvin_total_problems}={total_problems_together}>>{total_problems_together} math problems.
